front.div:
Abstract-Alternate path routing has been well-explored in telecom-
munication networks 88 a means of decreasing the call bloeklng rate and
increasing network utility. However, aside from some work applying these
concepts to unicast flows, altemate patb routing has received little atten-
tion in the Internet community. We describe and evaluate an architecture
for alternate path routing for multicast flows. For path installation, we
design a receiver-oriented altemate path protocol and prove that it recon-
figures multicast trees without introducing loops. For path computation,
we propose a scalable local search heuristic that allows receivers to find
alternate paths using only partial network information. We use a simula-
tion study to demonstrate the ability of local search to Rnd alternate paths
approximately as well as a link-state protocol, with much lower overhead.
